intro: Rhamphicarpa albersii, commonly known as the redroot sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern region. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and reddish roots. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas or along roadsides. Its small, spike-like inflorescence produces numerous tiny flowers, which are pollinated by wind, and it is adapted to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
